ca.uqac.lif.cep.tuples

Class MySqlSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf.Source
          • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tuples.MySqlSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable

    public class MySqlSource
extends Source
    Converts a query to a MySQL database into a trace of named tuples.

    Currently, this processor uses the MySQL JDBC driver. This could be changed to use other drivers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor

        SingleProcessor.InputPushable, SingleProcessor.OutputPullable

      protected String m_password
      The password used to connect to the database

      The query's result set, out of which tuples will be extracted one by one

    • Field Detail

      • m_tableName

        protected final String m_tableName
        The name of the database table to read from. Actually, this does not need to be a table name, as any SQL expression that returns a table (e.g. a SELECT statement) can do.

      • m_databaseName

        protected final String m_databaseName
        The name of the database to read from

      • s_jdbcDriver

        protected static final String s_jdbcDriver
        The URL string of the JDBC driver to use. Could be changed to other drivers than MySQL, eventually.
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MySqlSource

        public MySqlSource(String username,
           String password,
           String dbname,
           String tablename)
        Builds a MySQL source.
        Parameters:
        username - The username used to connect to the database
        password - The password used to connect to the database
        dbname - The database name to be read from
        tablename - The name of the table to be read from. Actually, this does not need to be a table name, as any SQL expression that returns a table (e.g. a SELECT statement) can do.

    • Method Detail

      • setFeedOneByOne

        public void setFeedOneByOne(boolean b)
        Sets whether the tuples of the underlying relation should be output one by one on every call to compute(Object[]), or output all at once on the first call to that method. While this has no effect on the end result, it might have an impact on the performance (e.g. if the source outputs a very large number of tuples in the output queue, which must be stored in memory).
        Parameters:
        b - Set to true to feed the tuples one by one, false otherwise

      • compute

        protected Queue<Object[]> compute(Object[] inputs)
        Description copied from class: SingleProcessor
        Computes one or more output events from its input events
        Specified by:
        compute in class SingleProcessor
        Parameters:
        inputs - An array of input events; its length corresponds to the processor's input arity
        Returns:
        A queue of vectors of output events, or null if no event could be produced
